House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00082
FULL TITLE : URGED CONGRESS TO EXERCISE ITS OVERSIGHT FUNCTIONS OVER THE UTILIZATION OF THE MOTOR VEHICLE USER'S CHARGE (MVUC) FUND
SHORT TITLE : Motor Vehicle User Charge (mvuc)
ABSTRACT : Rep. Bravo expressed concern on issues surrounding the Motor Vehicle User’s Charge (MVUC) Fund by first stressing that it is the third largest source of tax revenue in the country,... explaining its implementing rules and regulations which mandated the establishment of the Road Board, the DPWH Road Program and the DOTC Vehicle Pollution Control Fund Committee. He also cited the role of the Land Transportation Officer in the collection of MVUC Fund; the amount collected from 2004 to 2015 and where it was utilized; the reports and findings of the COA on the irregularities, misuse, improper and unliquidated use of the funds; the status of the implementation of the seven programmed infrastructure projects of the Road Board Secretariat for 2016; the COA report regarding the 2015 MVUC auditing; and the reason for the suspension and delay of projects under the National Road Lighting Program (NRLP)...Rep. Bravo expressed apprehension that a huge part of the fund is lost to graft and corruption. To exact transparency in the utilization of the MVUC Fund, he urged Congress to exercise its oversight functions over the fund and to scrutinize the expenditures of the DPWH) and DOTr), relative to its utilization so as to stop further wastage of public funds. (SOURCE: House Journal No.24,pp.14-15)
